items.title: Rio Olympics 2016: Team GB's record breakers return home from Rio
items.description: Great Britain's record-breaking Olympics team arrive from Rio to jubilant scenes when they land in London.

items.title: Heatwave alerts for south-east England as temperatures hit 30C
items.description: The Met Office issues heatwave alerts across the south and east of England, with temperatures expected to exceed 30C (86F) in some areas.

items.title: Damaged fire hydrant causes 30ft water spout in village
items.description: A damaged fire hydrant causes a 30ft water spout in the centre of a village as firefighters tackle a nearby blaze.

items.title: Mothers' pay lags far behind men
items.description: The gap between the hourly earnings of the two sexes becomes steadily wider after women have children, in part because mothers miss out on promotions, a study says.

items.title: Soldier dies in live firing training exercise in Northumberland
items.description: A soldier serving with the Royal Regiment of Scotland has died after being shot at a military training area in Northumberland, police say.

items.title: Virgin challenges Jeremy Corbyn train footage
items.description: Virgin Trains questions footage showing Jeremy Corbyn sitting on the floor of a "ram-packed" service, saying he had walked past available seats.

items.title: Jalal Uddin: Imam 'murdered by IS supporters' over 'black magic' healing
items.description: Two supporters of the so-called Islamic State group murdered an imam because they viewed his practice of Islamic healing as "black magic", a jury hears.

items.title: New strike dates in Southern guards safety dispute
items.description: Workers on Southern trains are to stage a 48-hour strike on 7 and 8 September, the RMT union announces.

items.title: Eynesbury Poppyfields care home death: Murder arrest after body find
items.description: Detectives arrest an 87-year-old man on suspicion of murder after a woman's body is found at a care home.

items.title: Ofsted boss quits after Isle of Wight row
items.description: Ofsted chairman David Hoare, who apologised after controversial remarks describing the Isle of Wight as a "ghetto", resigns.

items.title: Boy, 13, dies in North Warnborough farm Ferrari crash
items.description: A 13-year-old boy dies when the high performance sports car he was in crashed on a farm access road in Hampshire.

items.title: MP Heather Wheeler sparks Twitter backlash with British Empire post
items.description: An MP sparks a social media backlash after suggesting on Twitter the Olympics were won by the British Empire.

items.title: Team GB return from Olympics: Poet Pam Ayres pays tribute
items.description: The poet and broadcaster Pam Ayres has written a specially-commissioned piece to mark the return of Team GB from the Rio Olympics.

items.title: Team GB medallist Adam Peaty 'proud to be British'
items.description: Speaking at a news conference as Team GB returns to the UK, gold medal winner Adam Peaty speaks of his pride at being British - and his wish to inspire future generations.

items.title: Drone gives bird's eye view of Black Country aqueduct
items.description: A 200-year-old aqueduct that has undergone extensive repairs has been filmed from the air, offering a fresh look at the engineering ingenuity behind a historic canal network.

items.title: Richard III's 'death' captured in Battle of Bosworth re-enactment
items.description: The death of King Richard III is re-enacted and captured on camera from the point of view of the man who killed him.

items.title: Gender pay gap: Why do mums increasingly earn less?
items.description: The hourly gender pay gap increasingly widens year by year, after women become mothers, says a report - we hear a range of opinions.

items.title: Are you rubbish at recycling?
items.description: There has been a massive spike in the amount of recycling that gets rejected.

items.title: Outcry after Tesco drops saltires from Scottish berries
items.description: Supermarket giant Tesco is criticised after it admits removing an image of the Scottish saltire from punnets of Scottish berries.

items.title: Radio 1 DJ Nick Grimshaw flips his car on to its side while avoiding a ginger cat
items.description: Radio 1 breakfast show host Nick Grimshaw says he's fine after flipping his car over while trying to avoid running over a cat.

items.title: Newspaper headlines: HRT 'cancer risk' and Olympic honours
items.description: A "cancer risk" from hormone replacement therapy, a gender pay gap, and honours for Olympic athletes make the headlines.

items.title: Make dads stay at homeâ€¦
items.description: What are some of the steps that could be taken to narrow the pay gap between men and women?

items.title: Gargled message
items.description: Gargling with simple mouthwash might be a way to halt the spread of gonorrhoea, researchers believe.
